HlslLinker Class Reference

This class provides the implementation of the linker that will actually initiate the generation of the final GLSL code. More...

#include <hlslLinker.h>

Detailed Description

This class provides the implementation of the linker that will actually initiate the generation of the final GLSL code.

HlslCrossCompiler

bool HlslLinker::addCalledFunctions (  GlslFunction *  func,
std::set< GlslFunction * > &  funcSet,
std::vector< GlslFunction * > &  funcList
)  [protected]
 

Add the functions called by a function to the function set.

Add the functions called by a function to the function set

Parameters:
func The function for which all called functions will be added
funcSet The set of currently called functions
funcList The list of all functions
Returns:
True if all functions are found in the funcList, false otherwise.

bool HlslLinker::getArgumentData (  GlslSymbol *  sym,
EClassifier  c,
std::string &  outName,
std::string &  ctor,
int &  pad
)  [protected]
 

Get the GLSL name, constructor type and padding for a given symbol.

Get the GLSL name, constructor type and padding for a given symbol

Parameters:
symbol The symbol to get data for
c The classifier for the symbol (e.g. attribute, varying, etc.)
outName The final name to use for the symbol in the output GLSL code
ctor The constructor to use for creating the GLSL symbol
pad Any padding required in constructing the symbol
Returns:
True if argument data was retrieved succesfully, false otherwise.

)  [protected]
 

Get the GLSL name, constructor type and padding for a given argument.

Get the GLSL name, constructor type and padding for a given argument

Parameters:
name The name of the symbol
semantic The HLSL semantic for the symbol
type The GLSL type of the symbol
c The classifier for the symbol (e.g. attribute, varying, etc.)
outName The final name to use for the symbol in the output GLSL code
ctor The constructor to use for creating the GLSL symbol
pad Any padding required in constructing the symbol
semanticOffset When using an array variable bound to a semantic, this is the array offset
Returns:
True if argument data was retrieved succesfully, false otherwise.

)  [virtual]
 

This function is the main function that initiates code generation for the shader.

This function is the main function that initiates code generation for the shader.

Parameters:

True if linking is succesful, false otherwise

Enable the the output of a shader header to the GLSL output stream.

const char *  pName
)  [virtual]
 

If the user elects to use user attributes rather than built-ins, this function will set the user attribute name the user wishes to use for the semantic passed in.

Implements TLinker.

Strip the semantic string of any modifiers (e.g. _centroid)

Parameters:
semantic String of HLSL semantic for variable
